title: Die Linke - Wikipedia
snippet: Through the PDS, the party is the direct descendant of the Marxist–Leninist ruling party of former East Germany, the Socialist Unity Party of Germany (SED). Since October 2024, Die Linke's co-chairpersons have been Ines Schwerdtner and Jan van Aken. The party holds 64 seats out of 630 in ...

title: Inside Die Linke’s Resurgence
snippet: Jan van Aken, Die Linke party leader; Ines Schwerdtner; Heidi Reichinnek; and Gregor Gysi, direct candidate in Berlin, stand under the motto "Everyone wants to govern, we want to change" in Berlin on February 21, 2025.

title: Who is Heidi Reichinnek, the hard-left ‘Queen of TikTok’ shaking up German politics before election?
snippet: German The Left (Die Linke) party leader Heidi Reichinnek speaks during a session of the lower house of parliament Bundestag in Berlin, Germany, January 31, 2025.

title: The Improbable Resurgence of Die Linke
snippet: But becoming a party of the working class will take a lot more than a last-minute turnaround at the polls. Jan van Aken (L), federal chairman of Die Linke, and member of the Bundestag Gregor Gysi speak at a press conference in Berlin on February ...

title: After Germany’s Election, the Left Can Hope Again
snippet: Leading the way alongside Reichinnek were confident new faces in the party leadership: Ines Schwerdtner (formerly editor in chief of the German-language Jacobin) as well as Jan van Aken.
